signup.passwordError: Password must be at least 6 characters long
signup.usernameError: Username must be at least 4 characters long
signup.usernameErrorMessage: Your username must be 4 characters or more
signup.usernameNotEmail: Your username can not be an email
signup.usernamePublic: Your username will be publicly visible
signup.emailAlreadyUsed: Email already used by another account
signup.noAccountFoundForEmail: No account found for this email
signup.contributionWarningOnSignup: * All the data you contribute to MapSwipe is open and available to anyone. Your username is public, but your email and password will never be shared with anyone.
signup.loginExistingAccount: Log in to an existing account
signup.OSMsignupExplanation: You can signup to MapSwipe using your OpenStreetMap account. If you already have a MapSwipe account, this will not link them together! (this will come soon in a future release)
signup.sendResetEmailWarning: * We will send you an email to reset your password

profileScreen.x tasks (s swipes) until the next level: {{sqkm}} tasks ({{swipes}} swipes) until the next level
profileScreen.delete account warning:
You will lose all of your progress and badges. Your contributions will remain public but no longer tied to your account.
Would you like to continue?
profileScreen.accountDeletionFailedMessage: Please login again to confirm you want to delete your account

projectView.x pc global progress by n mappers: {{projectProgress}}% GLOBAL PROGRESS BY {{contributorCount}} MAPPERS JUST LIKE YOU.
projectView.quotaReachedWarning: Choose another project from the project screens

loadMoreScreen.completedTutorial: Good. You have completed the tutorial. You are ready to do some mapping!
loadMoreScreen.finishedGroup: Great job! You finished this group.
loadMoreScreen.sync alert message: Syncing your tasks... Do not close the app.

welcomeScreen.helpImprove: Help improve humanitarian responses from the comfort of your phone
welcomeScreen.withMissingMaps: With Missing Maps, we aim to put the world's vulnerable communities on the map
welcomeScreen.completeTasks: Complete tasks by swiping through satellite imagery of areas that need mapping
welcomeScreen.dataUse: The data is used to focus the efforts of Missing Maps volunteers to add detail to OpenStreetMap
welcomeScreen.mapHelps: The map helps organisations coordinate humanitarian efforts and save lives

CDInstructionScreen.lookingFor: You're looking for <1>changes in buildings</1>. This acts as a clear indicator for a change in population size.
CDInstructionScreen.noChanges: If there are no changes, simply <1>swipe</1> to the next photos
CDInstructionScreen.seeChanges: If you see a change in buildings, <1>tap once</1> and the tile turns green
CDInstructionScreen.unsure: Unsure? <1>Tap twice</1> and the tile will turn yellow
CDInstructionScreen.badImagery: Imagery issue, like if either image has clouds covering the view? <1>Tap three times</1> and the tile will turn red
CDInstructionScreen.holdZoom: If you need to see an image more closely, tap and hold the image and it'll zoom in a little more.
CDInstructionScreen.differentImagery: Sometimes different imagery sources will have been used. The images may be aligned slightly differently or might be a different resolution. Remember, you're looking for <1>definite changes in settlements and buildings</1> so if it looks like the same buildings are there, but maybe there's a new roof, then this would be a 'no change' scenario and you'd simply swipe to the next image.

ProjectLevelScreen.StopMappingAndReturn: Stop mapping and return to the menu?

IndividualCard.swipe down mark red: Swipe DOWN to mark all 6 tiles RED.

Tutorial.instructions3: Look for features listed in your project brief. Tap each tile where you find what you're looking for. Tap once for <1>YES</1>, twice for <3>{{twoTaps}}</3>, and three times for <5>BAD IMAGERY</5> (such as clouds).
Tutorial.instructions5: When you are done with a piece of the map, scroll to the next one by swiping.
Tutorial.instructions7: Hold a tile to zoom in on the tile.
Tutorial.instructions9: Tap and hold to hide icons and overlay.
Tutorial.tutorial2: This should make you a wizard of MapSwipe in a few minutes.
Tutorial.tutorial3: Just follow the instructions on the screen, and swipe left to continue.
Tutorial.tutorial4: If the instructions are in your way, just tap the message box to move it.

TutorialIntroScreen.thisTutoWillTeachYou: This tutorial will teach you how to use MapSwipe. Here are the basic steps:
TutorialIntroScreen.noChanges: If there is nothing relevant in the images, simply <1>swipe</1> to the next screen
TutorialIntroScreen.seeChanges: If you see something in one of the images, <1>tap once to turn the square green</1>.
TutorialIntroScreen.unsure: Not sure about what you see? <1>Tap twice to turn the square yellow</1>
TutorialIntroScreen.badImagery: If there is an issue with the imagery, <1>tap three times to turn the square red</1>
TutorialIntroScreen.tapAgain: Tap again to return the square to its original state.
TutorialIntroScreen.FromTheGround: From the ground, it looks like this:
TutorialIntroScreen.ImagesFromAbove: But the images you will see will show it from above, and it looks like this:

TutorialOutroScreen.dontWorryIfYoureUnsure: Don't worry if you're unsure about what you see in a square.
TutorialOutroScreen.youCanAlwaysTapTwice: Remember, you can always tap twice to mark the tile yellow if you are not sure about what you see
TutorialOutroScreen.everyImageViewedBy: Every image is viewed by multiple people, so don't worry if you missed something
TutorialOutroScreen.holdZoom: You can press and hold any square to zoom it. Tap again to dismiss it.

TutorialEndScreen.completedTutorial: You're now equipped with all you need to contribute to humanitarian mapping using the app. You can come back any time for a refresher.

BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.doesTheShapeOutlineABuilding: Does the shape outline a building?
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.everyTimeYouSelectAnOption: Every time you select an option, you'll be shown a new shape and image.
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.tapGreenText: Yes - the shape does outline a building in the image
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.tapRedText: No - the shape doesn't match a building in the image
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.tapGrayText: Not sure - if you're not sure or there is cloud cover / bad imagery
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.hideIconText: Hold down the hide button to remove the shape from the image
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.letsLearnHowToMap: Let's learn how to map with some examples
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.youllSeeASquare: You'll see a shape on an image. Use the buttons to answer:
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.squareContainsBuildings: Does the square contain any buildings?
BuildingFootprintTutorialIntroScreen.squareWillMove: The square will move around the image as you progress, following a grid like this:

BFTutorialOutroScreen.dontWorryIfYoureUnsure: Don't worry if you're unsure about a square
BFTutorialOutroScreen.youCanAlwaysTapUnsure: Remember, you can always tap the 'Not sure' button
BFTutorialOutroScreen.everyImageViewedBy: Every image is viewed by at least 3 MapSwipers, so it's ok if you think you've missed something
BFTutorialOutroScreen.youCanSwipeBack: You can swipe back to change your previous answers. Then tap or swipe forward again to get back to where you were.
BFTutorialOutroScreen.yourPreviousAnswerIsMarked: Your previous answers are marked with a white circle

BFInstructionsScreen.doesShapeOutlineABuilding: Does the shape outline a building?
BFInstructionsScreen.squareContainsBuildings: Does the square contain any buildings? Use the buttons to answer:
BFInstructionsScreen.instructionsYes: Yes: when there is a building or part of a building in the square
BFInstructionsScreen.instructionsNo: No: when there are no buildings in the square
BFInstructionsScreen.instructionsNotSure: Not sure: when your not certain if it's a building or not
BFInstructionsScreen.instructionsBadImagery: Bad imagery: when there is cloud cover or issues with the imagery
